an5.67:4.1: “Mendicants, any monk or nun who develops and cultivates five qualities can expect one of two results:
an5.67:4.2: final knowledge in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
an5.67:5.2: A mendicant develops the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm, and active endeavor … the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to energy, and active endeavor … the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to higher mind, and active endeavor … the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to inquiry, and active endeavor. And the fifth is just vigour.
an5.67:5.3: Any monk or nun who develops and cultivates these five qualities can expect one of two results:
an5.67:5.4: final knowledge in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
